content.body: bakkot: I never considered that f<a>() syntax issue. For some reason I thought there was a clever workaround. It can't use context, so a different syntax would need to be used entirely? Not sure if you follow TS stuff, did they talk about that a lot?
content.formatted_body: bakkot: I never considered that f<a>() syntax issue. For some reason I thought there was a clever workaround. It can't use context, so a different syntax would need to be used entirely? Not sure if you follow TS stuff, did they talk about that a lot?

content.body: I should have figured given Actionscript 3's design and the whole Vector.<T> syntax.
any attempt to actually pull in TS syntax for types would need to choose a different syntax for generic invocation, yes
I wasn't there when TS syntax was originally chosen but I imagine they didn't think it actually mattered given how they intended TS to be used, which was entirely reasonable of them
